No Poverty.reason: Course focuses on local revitalization and rural planning which inherently supports poverty reduction through improved local economies.

Zero Hunger.reason: No explicit mention or focus on food security or agricultural productivity in course description.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Indirect relevance through promoting well-being by addressing spatial and economic issues in rural communities.

Quality Education.reason: Course aims at interdisciplinary learning, field survey, GIS skills, and understanding of local revitalization â€” direct educational content.

Gender Equality.reason: No mention of gender-specific analysis or equality issues within the course framework.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: No clear reference to water resource or sanitation management in the course objectives.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: No focus on energy issues or clean energy solutions mentioned.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Course addresses economic aspects of rural revitalization and local industry, supporting decent work and growth concepts.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Focus on rural planning and economic industry aspects with integration of GIS implies infrastructure and innovation applications.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Local revitalization and rural focus may address spatial inequalities, but no explicit focus on social equality measures.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: Direct relevance through rural area planning and local community development as the core course topic.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: No specific mention of resource consumption or production sustainability practices.

Climate Action.reason: No explicit mention of climate change mitigation or adaptation actions in course description.

Life Below Water.reason: No reference to marine ecosystems or aquatic environment topics.

Life on Land.reason: Rural spatial planning and land-use analysis directly ties to sustainable management of terrestrial ecosystems.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: No direct discussion on governance, justice, or institutional strengthening in the course.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Indirectly supports partnerships by integrating interdisciplinary students and school resources, but not explicitly framed as SDG partnership.
